Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: matrona
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Residence Inn for 2 business trips one 3 weeks in January of this year and the latest being in March for 2 weeks. On both visits I was welcomed by the shuttle service drivers at the Montreal Airport by the most friendly drivers. They always welcome you back as if they have known you for ever. Once you arrive at the Hotel you are greeted by the most wonderful front desk staff which throughout your stay are always more than willing to make your stay as comfortable as possible. The rooms are spacious with a full kitchen, full size fridge, microwave, dish washer, and all dishes and utensils you will require. You are NOT expected to wash your dishes just give them a rinse and leave them in the sink and the cleaning staff will look after the rest. This is a wonderful touch when being on business. There is a shopping centre near by (walking distance) with a fantastic super market (Adonnis) that will meet and exceed all your food and beverage requirements. One of the best super markets I have ever been in. This Residence Inn also provides a full buffet breakfast each morning and a dinner buffet 2 and 3 nights on a rotating basis each week free of charge. All were very good during my stay. When away from home on business for an extended period of time this is as close to home as you can get. I highly recommend it. Matrona St. Andrews Manitoba

Reviews.Title: “Great stopover Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brookdj1
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the airport (10 of us) Promptly picked up and delivered to the hotel. The lobby is spacious and inviting with very friendly front desk staff. The only issue we had was due to the location (industrial/warehousing) the only restaurant was in the hotel, and it was closed for the evening. Other than that, great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel! Helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Kkw83
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a perfect location. The staff were helpful with tips about how to navigate the city. The room was clean and absolutely wonderful after a long day of travel. The breakfast was fine and I was impressed with the hotel overall.

Reviews.Title: “Better then you would think”
Reviews.Author: Joce B
Reviews.Content: Great place the night before a early morning flight. Clean, good food, quiet and the staff was very well trained.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Residence Inn - Nice hotel to stay in....”
Reviews.Author: Nitin1282
Reviews.Content: I stayed for around 35 days in the hotel. The hotel is nice to stay and the location is also very nice. You have a Mall very near "Place vertu" where you can do lot of shopping.... Hotel provides free shuttle service to Airport which is also very cool......you save money :) Theatre near hotel....."Guzzo"......so enjoy movies Electronics shopping can be done as Futureshop is very near...... Metro station is also near..... You can choose this hotel... :)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: DaSenator
Reviews.Content: I stayed a week while on business. Nice room with easy access to restaurants and business. The staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jjames1961
Reviews.Content: Have over 80 nights in this hotel since May 2011, excellent/clean hotel esp suited for a business person. Breakfast is free and fine, my only complaint is the internet, you cannot conduct business or connect to VPN in the rooms due to the constant disconnecting of your router connection. Free HIGH speed is required, even cheap hotels can accomplish this...... Plse fix this ASAP, even when the hotel is full lets have HIGH speed. Great Hotel !!!!! James 80 NIGHTS and counting.......

Reviews.Title: “very good all suite hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luke S
Reviews.Content: This property is everything your would to come to expect from a brand new Marriott residence. Any rooms are great, very quiet, full kitchen. Clean and great service. Easy access from A40. Very nice breakfast in mornings. very nice hared pool with Courtyard which is same building.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!EXCELLENT HOTEL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travleinggirl
Reviews.Content: EXCELLENT HOTEL. One of the best I've ever stayed in. SPOTLESSLY CLEAN!!! Friendly staff who are always willing to help. HUGE CLEAN ROOMS. Would stay there again in a heartbeat. No problems or complaints here at at all.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: Marslov
Reviews.Content: At first, I was skeptical about the Residence Inn Marriott but I decided give it a shot. I stayed one night, October 08/11. I am glad I did. The hotel is located in a small industrial park area. But it was not a detractor to the inner beauty of the hotel. The area was quiet. And, no, it is not as close to the airport as I thought but that was a non an issue for me. However it is within walking distance of a mall. Given the isolation of the hotel, I was still able to get around easily. A ten minute or less walk along Beaulac to De La Cote-Vertu, I caught a bus to the station in going to Downtown Montreal. If one drives, it is even better. Great place to stay. It is literally sparkling clean. The suite resembles that of a junior condo unit with everything besides a washer and a dryer; there is no word of a lie. I stayed in the King Studio with Sofa Bed. The convenience of the place felt like home. The inclusive breakfast was not continental. It was a nice buffet with all the right breakfast items. I would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: PPDR
Reviews.Content: Very new and clean, great roomy suite, awesome brEakfast buffet, accommodating staff

Reviews.Title: “Sleep and eat in comfort”
Reviews.Author: fell0wtraveler48
Reviews.Content: We had been camping for several days and arrived in Montreal, exhausted. It was a Sunday night and we had no place to stay. We called Marriott and learned about a very reasonably priced Residence Inn close by. It was a wonderfully clean, friendly, and comfortable hotel. Everything as we expected it to be...giving us a great head-start for the morning drive to a new campground.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: HKJ420
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great!! Very well located, right off of the transcanada. In between the suburbs and downtown montreal. Close to the airport. The rooms have a great kitchenette, offer free wifi and free continental breakfast every morning! They also offer shuttle service to airpor and free parkingt.The rooms are very modern and clean. The beds are very conformatable. Staff is great. Love the front desk. Always smiling and very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: RRSAMIC
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice Residence Inn outside of Montreal. We tried to drive to the nearest metro station but it wasn't that close, so we drove into downtown anyway. This is about 20 minutes in good traffic. I say that because right now the construction around the Montreal highways is horrible! . So, if you don't mind driving into town, this is a nice place. Free parking, clean, and a very good breakfast which is included.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Norm300
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here each year for the last several while attending the Canadian GP. This is an excellent hotel and would highly reccomend it. Service is great and staff is very helpful. Although not downtown, it is an easy drive to downtown or you are not far from a bus stop that takes you to a Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel... Not convenient to sights”
Reviews.Author: joyreneeNj
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days for a business trip from Monday-Friday (Aug8 - Aug12) and thought it was a decent experience. The room was very clean, bed unfortunately was quite hard and uncomfortable. The hotel staff is helpful and gives great advice for places to eat/things to do in the surrounding area. Whenever I needed a taxi, it was VERY prompt and they take credit cards which was helpful to expense my transportation (my company credit card is AMEX). Surprisingly, this Residence Inn provides room service - it's attached to a Courtyard Marriott that has a restaurant. The food was decent. Hotel aside, it you're looking for convenience to the sights (Old Montreal, Notre Dame cathedral, waterfront, etc) you'd be better off in town. Although the Residence Inn is considerably less expensive, round trip taxi service to go in town can run you about $80 or more. This hotel is VERY convenient to various companies if you're here for business, however. You can arrange for daily pick ups and drop offs to your company which are all less than 10 minutes away (including Canon, Brother, Merck, Valeant, Elan, etc). Overall, I enjoyed my stay - Old Montreal is great to see this time of year. By the way, unless you're a die hard fan of Chinese food and bubble tea, no need to visit Chinatown. If you've been to one Chinatown in any state, you been to them all - nothing special...

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, very professional staff, wonderfull breakfast”
Reviews.Author: kline22
Reviews.Content: It was a real surprise to discover this hotel near to the airport but also near to Cotes de Vertu district in Montreal. Room are very convenient with a real kitchen, wonderfull breakfast, very professional and helpfull staff (reception, breakfast, maid). Nice swimming pool, free intenet. Everything for a pleasant stay in familly or business

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaVisitor
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it was a lot cheaper than staying in the downtown area and it had free parking. If you have a car, this is the way to go. The rooms were very nice and clean. We had two rooms. One faced the freeway and was a bit noisier than the one facing the side road. The rooms had all the amenities you needed. We also used the laundry room which was clean and reasonably priced. They offered a free dinner to guests on the Thursday night we were there. They had a nice selection of food. The choice of food for the complementary breakfast was very nice. We were at the hotel for 3 nights. One day when we arrived for breakfast, almost all the food was out. They refilled the food very slowly. The other two days was better. I think they just needed more staff because the hotel was very busy. Also because it was so busy, it was hard to find a place to sit down. On busy days, they need to have more staff and perhaps set up more tables in the hallway and in the lobby area to accommodate everyone. There is a movie theater within walking distance which is a plus. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Covinient for a short stay in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Robw9257
Reviews.Content: Although it is a few miles from the City center, this hotel is convinient for the airport which is 10 mins away, especially if one has an early flight. The hotel has a free shuttle bus which runs every 30 mins from 4am to midnight. The suites are large and comfortable and the breakfast buffet is good and varied. The hotel staff are friendly and prepared to offer detailed advice on what to do/see in the area and how to get there. A cab ride to old Montreal is $40 each way. Public transport, bus plus subway, is $3 per person.

Reviews.Title: “For an "airport" location outside of the city, we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: davidmeyer
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to stay downtown Montreal when my wife and I visited the city for our 16th Anniversary, but I had burned a ton of hotel points this year already, so I had to make due with what I could find. I was really expecting a disaster, but we were so pleased by this hotel I cannot say ANYTHING negative about it. It was truly a wonderful experience, despite the short drive to the city. The rooms were like new, and the staff was first rate (except for the kitchen staff that was REALLY snotty when it came to shutting down the evening manager's reception...they didn't appreciate anyone showing up with five minutes to spare.) Breakfast was great though, and the staff...I know I have mentioned them already, but really...much better than what you might get at this type of hotel. While I stayed there for my anniversary, I will stay there again for business.

Reviews.Title: “Our family loved staying here !”
Reviews.Author: tourist_travails
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel we stayed in on our trip to Montreal/ Quebec and was the best one. Ideal for a family of 4 like ours. The King bed and queen sofa bed worked out great.The mattress on the King bed was sooooo comfortable (better than the $1000 simmons beauty rest we recently bought)...had a good nights sleep after many days.The bathroom was very very clean! The kitchenette was very useful! The big breakfast spread was one of the best I've had. Highly recommend this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Suite Hotel near the airport"”
Reviews.Author: Pilgrim1050
Reviews.Content: Not your typical rambling Residence Inn property. Shares a mid rise building with Courtyard Hotel. Not the nearest to the airport (about 15 minutes), but shuttle every 30 minutes worrks. That being said there is no easy way to get to the Center, even thought you are already 15 minutes closer than the airport. A rental car is probably the best alternative. The suites are nicly appointed, including kitchen, and relatively large. The staff ishelpful and the included morining breakfast, although not cooked to order, is large and varied. The two night a week "manager's reception" can be a decent dinner if one doesn't go out for something special.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel away from the city”
Reviews.Author: sars82
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd Residence Inn and we were equally happy on all 3 stays. This Residence is an Airport hotel and is near to the Montreal airport and provides free shuttles to the airport. The room are spacious and well equipped. If you are staying with a family don't go in for the bachelor room as it is suited for 1 person stay only. We had to struggle a few days in such a room before moving a 1 bed room suite. There is a good shopping mall called 'Place Vertu' at a 5 minute walk. It has Sears, Zellers, Canadian Tire and Adonis. Adonis is a super market with good and affordable middle eastern food. You also get fresh fruits and veggies at a reasonable price. There are buses that go from there to the nearest subway - Cote Vertu. You can use the same ticket for a transfer to the metro. The hotel offers a free car parking. The other 2 Residence inns in Montreal charge a car parking fee of more than $15. The breakfast is excellent and you have all the options every day. Evening socials in this hotel is from Tue to Thu, but it is not as exciting as the other Residence inns we stayed. There is free Wifi and a business centre. The Gym is good and is shared with the Courtyard hotel. The laundry charge is $2 each for washing and drying. There is a ironbox and board in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good location to eventually Get to your ski hill”
Reviews.Author: JMSKITZ
Reviews.Content: We were travelling from Nova Scotia by car and this was a good place to stop before getting to Mt. Tremblant. Breakfast was free and had much variety and we partucularly like the waffle maker. Also had a great nights sleep considering how close we were to the airport. Only awkward moment was trying to find the entry to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Great Rooms. Fantastic Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: roadwarriorvb
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many Residence Inns throughout North America. This one is by far the best. Centrally located in the Montreal Suburb od St-Laurent, it's a quick skip to the airport and downtown. Plenty of restaurants, shopping, movie theatres, grocery stores within walking distance. The rooms are large, well-appointed with the customary full kitchen. The facilities include a nice fitness room and pool. But, by far, this "Rez" has the best free buffet breakfast on the continent.

Reviews.Title: “A great home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: countryjen
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. I am a big Marriott fan and this one definately met all of my expectations. The rooms are basically a little appartment with all of the comforts of home. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lounge ambience”
Reviews.Author: Indochinaexplorer
Reviews.Content: Located just after the arrival hall. The Hotel is designed in a mondern style look with lots of woods, which makes the area nice and cosy even in an airprot milieu. The sparcious hall and rooms gives you a nice felling of not being put into a small room. Good restaurant and bar, free wi fi in the hall, charge in the room. Fitness and SPA/Pool area is fine. Some noise from airport. Try to get a room higher up. Also fine conference room facilities for small/larger groups. However quite pricy, but a fine stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good amenities”
Reviews.Author: parveend
Reviews.Content: I visited this place with some of my colleagues for some business related work for 3 weeks. The hotel checkin was good, hotel rooms were clean, rooms were spacious, It is one of the preferred hotels for my organization for travel to Montreal. Located near Transcanadian highway, its got connectivity to all nearby places and also well connected to shopping complex Place Vertu. Downtown is around 15 kms from this place. The hotel staff was friendly and checkin & checkout process was good. There was computer table & chair, sofa, wardrobe, microwave, fridge, iron and iron board, coffee/tea maker, large TV in the room added to the double bed. Supplies in the bathroom were ample and you never run out of those. The rates were ok as we have our corporate rates, or else for travellers on their own this place maybe a bit expensive than others nearby. Internet was complimentary (both wired and wireless).and speed was ok. Breakfast was good with combination of continental, & cooked food. Coffee & Tea are free 24 hours. They also provide common computer and printing facility free of charge. They also provide shuttle services to airport and office though at fixed time (30 mins in between). The kitchen provided included everything a person needs to cook and eat. They also provide free grocery service with no extra charges. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay with all the creature comforts close by.”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaKiraHannah
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a two night stay at this Marriott Residence Inn by the Airport. We had a room on the 6th floor with one king bed and a sofa bed. The room was IMMACULATE. We were very happy with the sound proofing, even with the airplanes going overhead we barely heard them. The location was perfect for us. We were a hop-skip and a jump from the brand new IKEA store and we were close to a shopping mall, (walking distance during daylight hours). There is a giant movie theatre across the street and lots of restaurants. The room was well equipped as are most Residence Inns. The staff was very friendly and efficient, check in was a quick and easy which is exactly what you want when you are tired from travelling all day. The free parking and easy access from the highway made this stay well worth having to drive a little bit to get to the heart of Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, room and staff”
Reviews.Author: edinbc
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to stay. The staff were friendly and accommodating. On our first morning there, my wife went down ahead of me. For whatever reason we thought the breakfast buffet (a full one) ended at 10 am. She went down at 8:45 only to learn it ended at 9 am during the week and I wouldn't make it in time. She made a plate of food for me but when I arrived at 9:05, the staff went and brought out some warm food for me although they were already taking down the buffet. Room are large (all suites) with microwaves, sink, dishes and a full size fridge and freezer complete with ice maker. Location is close to Montreal airport and very easy access on and off the Trans Canada Highway offering easy (minus all the traffic) access wherever you are heading. Marriott has won us over.

Reviews.Title: “Employees”
Reviews.Author: Traveler428105
Reviews.Content: Since a long time I have found a hotel with excellent staff! From Reception over the barman to the waiters and cooks at breakfast, all where excellent. Rooms are big and quiet, the beds are comfortable. Valet parking is comfortable but expensiv. The morning buffet is not the biggest I have seen but the quality of the food is very good. All over a place I can recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience, recommend it highly”
Reviews.Author: TrippyNH
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend with spouse and two kids. The room comes standard with a king-sized bed and a sofabed, plus a small kitchenette. We requested a roll-away (so kids don't fight over who's on "their" side of the bed, and the hotel had one in the room when we arrived. The room was very clean and comfortable. We enjoyed having the refrigerator and ice-maker in the room, too. Breakfast was included, and was good, although very crowded. We were using the hotel mainly as a hub for sightseeing in the town, but the 15 minute drive into downtown was not bad, at all. I was pleasantly surprised to find that parking was available and inexpensive. I was very pleased with the hotel, and highly recommend it to travelers, both business and recreational.

Reviews.Title: “Really great - definitely will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: leframboise
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel. The one bed suite was great! Lots of room, all the things you need in the kitchen...nice living area, nice bathroom, and CLEAN. I was not afraid to let my baby walk around the place as it was clean and tidy. Residence Inn beds are always the same though...lacking in the comfy linens/duvet department. Not bad though and clean which is most important. Location: The planes are not a problem re: noise. Movie theatre and some chain type restos around the corner. Not too far to drive into downtown either.

Reviews.Title: “5-star quality at a 2-star price”
Reviews.Author: Toronto_Travelling
Reviews.Content: Fabulous experience! Drove into Montreal for a family birthday party and needed a hotel close to the Transcanada Hwy for a quick return to Toronto. Found this hotel on-line and got a great deal ($130 all-in per night). Hotel looked brand new from the outside and we weren't disappointed. Check-in was super fast and super easy. Room had plenty of closet space and came with a beautiful fully functional kitchen. (were those granite countertops I saw??) Although our room overlooked the highway and we found ourselves next door to a room with a small yapping dog, once our door was closed we heard absolutely nothing. (I am an extremely light sleeper, so the fact that the room was literally soundproof to the outside, makes this a "must-return" venue for me.) And finally, the buffet breakfast that was included in the room rate was absolutely fantastic. For those of us not watching our weight, we had a choice of pancakes, waffles, eggs and sausages. For the rest of us, there was fresh fruit, yoghurt and plenty of cereal choices. And everything was delicious. Add on an extremely friendly and helpful hotel staff , and you've got one terrific hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull room and staff”
Reviews.Author: mareby
Reviews.Content: This hotel is also attached to the Courtyard Marriot which had a Bar and Restaurant. The Residence was well appointed and our suite was perfect. Every member of the staff always greeted us with a smile and hello. The breakfast was wonderful. Eggs, sausage, make your own waffles and all the other breakfast items you can think of! Plenty of seating. On Tues./Thurs. they offer a little dinner spread. We were lucky to have arrived on a Thursday. We walked over to the Courtyard for a glass of wine, then back to the little dinner spread. We were delighted to get something to eat without leaving the hotel......and free! We used public transpertation to get into the city. About a 5-6 block walk to bus which takes you to the train. We bought a 3 day pass for all public transportation. Also at that bus stop was a terrific mall. From the outside it looked pretty bad. But they are working on re-doing the entire outside. Inside was everything you could need, including a huge food store, a dollar store, a food court, banks, etc. Also in that same area, there are plenty of eating establishments. We had a rental car to drive to these spots, but you can hike it. I would especially like to mention John at the desk. he was so very helpful in our stay. He even helped me find my husband when I lost him!! I am unable to address housekeeping because we do not use housekeeping when we travel. We make up our own room. The hotel did not disappoint. It made for a very nice anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Preferred the Fairfield Suites”
Reviews.Author: honesttripreviewer
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Residence Inn after arriving on a flight from out of town. We called for the shuttle which arrived within about 15 minutes. The hotel was about a 10-15 minute drive. It was not real easy to find if you were driving yourself. Check in was fine and the room was fine. We had a family of 4 staying and found the suite to be a little crowded but still nice. The breakfast in the morning was the typical free breakfast with a few hot items. On our way back home we were to stay there one more night but opted for the Fairfield Suites instead. We thought it was an upgrade from the Residence Inn plus it was closer to the airport. The staff at the Fairfield was extremely helpful. The downside to the Fairfield was you paid for parking if you had a car, you occasionally heard a plane since you were so close, it was not easy to find the turn in as others have stated and you can not walk to any restaurant or shopping. But, given those issues, my family still preferred the Fairfield and I preferred the lower price and the great help and advice at the Fairfield. I would recommend either for a stay as both were fine.

Reviews.Title: “Super Convenient, Super Stay”
Reviews.Author: moogie14a
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Residence Inn 6/16 through 6/20. I was originally booked at the Courtyard which is next door and accessible by the Residence Inn but changed it due to the lower per night cost and the availability of a free breakfast. Checking in was a bit slow. There was only one young lady working the front desk during the peak check in time, Monday evening. She was friendly and helpful. I even got a lower rate since I had a mega bucks certificate and was even able to use it! I had a king studio room which I loved. There was a microwave a full size fridge, stove, and utencils. I found the room very comfortable and clean. Breakfast was good. Loved the croissants in the morning. I always took an extra one and a piece of fruit with me. It is short drive to Trudeau. If you have a rental car, I suggest filling up near this hotel. There are two pumps close by. The hotel is near Cote-Vertu (shopping mall) I found it closes too early to enjoy after work. There are some nice restaurants within walking distance on a nice day. The Residence Inn is a great value. I think it's like an Embassy Suites without the booze! I'm not sure why they would put a Courtyard and a Residence Inn next to each other. I certainly would choose the Residence Inn if I had to choose between the two. Seems like Marriott has too many niches.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ja81th
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel and were very pleased with the overall cleanliness of the hotel. Moreover the staff went out of their way to assist us in many ways. It is connected to a Courtyard and the restaurant there was excellent, with friendly, prompt service. Although it is located close to the Trudeau Airport and Autoroute 40, the soundproofing is excellent and we were never bothered by noise. Highly recommended as a convenient alternative to staying downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra Clean - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: LBTB
Reviews.Content: Only in Mtl for the weekend - we only stayed one night and were pleasantly surprised. Ultra clean - the bathroom was the cleanest bathroom I have ever seen - Our room was beautiful - nicely decorated and also exceptionally clean. Everything was in great shape. The hotel was quiet and the staff pleasant. This hotel is close to the Airport and is in an industrial area, however, there were restaurants within walking distance and Cote Vertu shopping centre is close by as well. Our rate was $122 and the value was amazing. Absolutely nothing negative to say - it was all great.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: NJDaphne
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with two young adult sons to visit family in the area during Christmas vacation and chose this hotel because it offered the extra space and privacy we needed while being conveniently located between family members living in the city and on the West Island. We had a great stay. We arrived after a long drive on the Tuesday after Christmas and enjoyed a ( free!) light dinner of soup and delicious and nicely presented sandwiches, just what we needed at that point. The hotel is conveniently located near the Dorval (aka Pierre Trudeau) airport and close to major highways, but despite the plane and car traffic nearby, it was exceptionally quiet; great soundproofing in this new (2006) hotel! Several stores, restaurants, even a cinema complex, were within easy and safe walking distance from the hotel, and downtown Montreal was quickly and easily accessible by car. Everything was clean and fresh, the staff was friendly and helpful, and we would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Inexpensive Trip”
Reviews.Author: Tilly&Kyle
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as I was able to book several nights using my remaining Marriott Reward points. This hotel was very nice and clean. The rooms were very comfortable (beware - the mattresses are VERY firm). Breakfast had several options, and we were very pleased. We took cabs to the nearby Metro station to get into downtown Montreal. We found the Metro to be a great way to get around the city. There is a movie theatre and several restaurants in the area for things to do that are in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: Ywatkins
Reviews.Content: As a mother of twins, a great quiet suite was very important to us. Brought the 5mo olds up to visit in-laws. The check-in was smooth. We left and visited family. When we returned we were informed that there was no electricity in any of the hotel rooms, only the common areas. The nice front desk staff gave us two flashlights. One of the main reasons we booked a suite was so that we could have the bassinet in a separate room and have access to a dishwasher. Needless to say, it was a very long night. The following morning I contacted to the front desk to find out how much of a discount we would receive I was informed that since the power outage was not their fault (hydro was doing repairs), they would not be issuing a discount. After the lights came back on, the rooms were very nice and the free breakfast was better than most-hash browns and french toast were on the menu.

Reviews.Title: “New Great Value Hotel - You have to stay here if you have a car”
Reviews.Author: valushopper
Reviews.Content: Residence Inn just opened end of Aug 2006. We definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting Montreal with a car especially for families and individuals who need extended stay facilities for their spacious rooms fully equipped with a kitchenette & dinette. The kitchenette had a stove top range, fridge, microwave, dishwasher, coffee maker, china and cutlery. I'm sure I would miss listing some other appliances, but in general I believe that this had more appliances than a standard Residence Inn (I have only been to 3 in total). . We were in a studio with a king sized bed and a queen or twin sized sofa bed. It was comfortable for our family of 3 adults and one child. It was our first visit to Montreal and wanted a room in downtown. However, after comparing prices, not to mention, additional costs for hotel parking (average of $ 18/day) downtown and a lot of bad reviews on mid-level hotels, we decided staying in this airport hotel. It was a pleasant surprise to find out that it was just 10 minutes (off-peak) to 40 minutes (peak) to downtown. Walking distance was a shopping complex with cinemas and restos. A complimentary hot and cold breakfast buffet was so filling that we had lunch at 3pm later in the day. This is versus the 1 croissant and a cup of OJ I have read on other downtown hotel reviews. I also read that most downtown hotels are old and had small rooms even for the mid-level brands. 'The staff was very friendly and helpful, nothing else we could have asked for.
